caption.p: Increased viral transmission rates result in increased epidemic growth but similar set point dynamics. A. Infected individuals and B. Mean set point viral load over time. Variation in the annual rate of transmission ( B max in Equation 3) significantly affects epidemic growth (due to changes in the number of susceptible individuals), but does not affect the evolutionarily optimal set point viral load (although it changes the shape of SPVL change).
